sen.e: In the evening of June 5, 1864 and around Sanjo-bashi bridge, FUJISAKI and his fellow, Gokichiro NOOIYAMA was questioned by a group of guards of the Tokugawa shogunate who were guarding under tight security due to Ikedaya incident, a fight using swords started, FUJISAKI killed two guards with his sword, and FUJISAKI himself was also injured.

In the evening of June 5, 1864 and around Sanjo-bashi bridge, FUJISAKI and his fellow, Gokichiro NOOIYAMA were questioned by a group of guards of the Tokugawa shogunate who were carrying out guard duty due to strict security that ensued due to the Ikedaya incident, and a fight using swords started, FUJISAKI killed two guards with his sword, and FUJISAKI himself was also injured.
